p: Compounds 262, 426– 427 were evaluated for their cytotoxicity against a human leukemia cell line (K562), a colon adenocarcinoma cell line (SW480), and a human liver carcinoma cell line (HepG2). Compounds 262 and 427 showed moderate cytotoxic activity against all the tested cell lines with IC 50 ranging from 12.0 to 28.3 µM (IC 50 values against K562, SW480, and HepG2 cells: 262: 15.9 (13.1–19.3) µM, 12.0 (8.8–16.4) µM, 28.3 (23.2–34.6) µM 427: 20.6 (14.0–30.3) µM, 20.3 (16.8–24.4) µM, 20.4 (16.4–25.4) µM). In addition, compound 426 showed moderate cytotoxicity towards K562 cells with an IC 50 value of 18.7 µg/mL. Cisplatin was used as the positive control with IC 50 values of 3.8, 5.5, and 6.8 µM toward K562, SW480, and HepG2 cells, respectively [ 86].
